column1: A certain amount of restraint is best for us all. As the just restraints of the law are best for men and women
column2: so the proper restraints of home are best for boys and girls. A lad from whom all restraining influences are suddenly withdrawn—who can have his own way unmolested—stands in the greatest danger of wrecking his life. The temptations of power have been the cause of very much of the world's sadness and misery. And this temptation came to this boy King of Sweden called in his fifteenth year to supreme sway over a large realm of loyal subjects. Freed from the severity of his stern father's discipline
column3: he found himself responsible to no one—absolutely his own master. And he did what too many of us
column5: would have done in his position—he determined to have a jolly good time
column6: come what might; and he had it—in his way.
